summary: The "European public limited company," commonly referred to as a "European company," represents a unique legal form of organization within the European Union. Established under Regulation (EC) No. 2157/2001, this entity allows companies to operate across EU member states with a unified legal framework. It facilitates cross-border mergers and enhances corporate mobility, thus promoting economic integration. The European company structure is designed to simplify regulatory compliance and provide a flexible governance model, enabling businesses to adapt to diverse market conditions while benefiting from the single market. This concept underscores the EU's commitment to fostering a cohesive business environment.
